creator: beland@alum.mit.edu
text:
When I start JMeter with "bash bin/jmeter", it takes a very long time
(about 2 minutes) for the first screen to appear, and the CPU is
pegged at 100% the entire time.  

After I choose "Help" from the "Help" menu, it takes about 20 seconds
for the help window to appear, and it takes another 40 seconds or so
for any content to appear.  When I highlight the content that shows up
in that window using the mouse, the following appears in the terminal
I used to start JMeter:

GC Warning: Repeated allocation of very large block (appr. size 593920):
        May lead to memory leak and poor performance.

If I obscure the Help pop-up with another window and un-obscure it, it
takes longer to redraw than I'm willing to wait, so I've killed the
application and am going to write some custom scripts instead of using
JMeter.

This is on a 1.4GHz Toshiba laptop with about 700MB of RAM, running
Fedora 6.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Works OK for me - what version of Java are you using?

Check jmeter.log for errors.

creator: beland@alum.mit.edu
text:
Performance is much improved after changing the java binary from a
java-1.4.2-gcj-compat-1.4.2.0-40jpp.110 RPM to jdk-1.6.0_01-fcs.
